{"step_by_step_thinking": "If a person is HBsAg positive but Anti-HBc Ab is negative, it indicates that the person is currently infected with hepatitis B virus (HBV) but does not have any previous exposure to the virus. In this case, the next step would be to check the HBV DNA load to determine the level of viral replication and assess the severity of the infection. This will help in determining the appropriate management and treatment options.", "answer_choice": "B"}
